_header: Whoso desireth to get and conquer
_description: Thomas Hoccleve, A miracle of the Virgin Mary: How Our Lady’s Psalter was first found — eighteen stanzas rhyme royal

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
[W]ho so desyrith to gete and conquereThe blysse of hevene holsom
                    ys a guyde…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…And in her grace cherly for to stondeHer psalter for to sey
                    let us fonde Amen
OxfChrCh152.Note:
In Hoccleve’s autograph MS, (6603-3), the first three stanzas are referred to
                    as the ‘prologus’, with the tale comprising the final fifteen
                    stanzas. The same structure is found here, with two spurious linking stanzas
                        (681) prefaced to the
                    prologue.
OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title:

                    Ploughmannys Tale (f. 231)

                    mannys syde…

                    fonde
